title: Mukesh Ambani Reliance Jio announcement: 10 key takeaways
text:
Mukesh Ambani Reliance Jio announcement: 10 key takeaways Mukesh Ambani Reliance Jio announcement: 10 key takeaways Reliance Industries chairman and MD Mukesh Ambani on February 21 made some announcements regarding Reliance Jio. Here are the top 10 takeaways. By: FE Online | Updated: February 21, 2017 2:25 PM Mukesh Ambani added that India is now the number one country in the world in terms of mobile data usage. He said that Reliance Jio’s 4G network base is more than all other rivals combined together. (Picture: Reuters) 
Reliance Industries chairman and MD Mukesh Ambani on February 21 announced that Reliance Jio crossed a subscriber base of 100-mn in record 170 days time. While talking on Jio and its achievements, Ambani made several comments. He also thanked Jio subscribers for trusting the network. Ambani added that India is now the number one country in the world in terms of mobile data usage. He said that Jio’s 4G network base is more than all other rivals combined together. Ambani also announced several other specifics regarding Jio’s path to the future. He also announced the tariff plans which the Jio subscribers will have to pay. Following the commercial launch of Reliance Jio, it has witnessed a fast rise, especially because of its lucrative offers that include lifetime free voice calls, free data along with a subscription to content apps. The free offers had helped Reliance Jio shoot to the top league of telecom operators in India. In January, Reliance had claimed 72.4 million subscribers onboard. Here are the most important announcements that Mukesh Ambani made in his Reliance Jio speech: 
1. Jio Prime membership programme at a one-time fee of Rs 99. Jio Prime Members can continue enjoying the unlimited benefits of JIO NEW YEAR OFFER until 31st March 2018 . 
2. Jio Prime Members can get the benefits at an introductory price of only Rs 303 per month , effectively just Rs 10 per day. 
3. Jio will match the highest selling tariff of other operators and provide 20% more data than what other operators provide. 
4. In just 170 days since its launch, Jio has crossed the 100 million customer mark on its 4G LTE network! 
5. Jio has added, on average, nearly 7 customers on its network every second of every day. 
6. Jio users consumed more than 100 Crore GB of data per month on the Jio network. That’s more than 3.3 Crore GB a day. 
7. Jio carries nearly 5.5 crore hours of video daily on its network. 
8. Jio has more than double the number of 4G base stations when compared to all the other Indian operators put together. In the coming months, Jio will more than double its data capacity which means better quality for customers. 
9. With the Aadhaar-based process, initiating Mobile Number Portability has become a simple and fast process. Our network will soon cover 90 per cent of India. 
10. On all of Jio’s tariff plans, all domestic voice calls to any network will always remain ‘ free ‘. Please Wait while comments are loading...
